intro: Euaraliopsis fatsioides, commonly known as the Fatsia-like plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by red berries. Euaraliopsis fatsioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
